general_advisory: Irrigate the crop if it shows soil moisture deficiency. Prepare the field for paddy transplantation. Spraying of insecticides and pesticides should be done at early morning or during evening hours.

advisory: Make sure the soil is well puddled before transplanting paddy.
Be careful while transplanting. The field should have good water stand.
Monitor the field for any diseases and pests.
Blast diseases (spindle shaped spots with grey centre and brown margin along with burnt appearance) may appear in areas with frequent rainfall and high humidity.
Remove grasses and other weeds from the main field.
Apply recommended fertilizers as per crop requirements.
Monitor for pests and diseases especially fall army worm.
Apply appropriate fungicides to manage diseases like Fusarium wilt and cercospora leaf spot.
Irrigate the crops at regular intervals.
Collect and destroy affected fruits to manage fruit and shoot borer.
Treat the seeds with Thiram to prevent diseases.
Implement hormone spraying to increase flowering.
Practice proper irrigation methods.
Avoid waterlogging to prevent rotting.
Remove affected terminal shoots showing boreholes for fruit and shoot borer management.
In severe cases, apply Emamectin benzoate.
Prevent waterlogging to avoid rotting.
Remove affected terminal shoots to manage fruit and shoot borer.
Apply Emamectin benzoate in severe cases.
Use Imidachloprid to manage Thrips, ants, and other pests.
Regularly monitor the field for diseases and pests.
